titleStmt.title: The Earl of Manchesters speech to His Maiesty, in the name of the peers, at his arrival at White-Hall, the 29th of May, 1660. With His Maiesties gracious answer thereunto.
titleStmt.author: Manchester, Edward Montagu, Earl of, 1602-1671.

titleStmt.title: The Earl of Manchesters speech to His Maiesty, in the name of the peers, at his arrival at White-Hall, the 29th of May, 1660. With His Maiesties gracious answer thereunto.
titleStmt.author: Manchester, Edward Montagu, Earl of, 1602-1671.
Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.
England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II)

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by John Macock and Francis Tyton, printers to the House of Lords,

notesStmt.note: "His Majesties gracious answer to the Earle of Manchesters speech" has separate dated title page and pagination; register is continuous.
Royal arms on verso of first leaf, verso of 2nd title page, and recto of final leaf. First and last leaf are otherwise blank.
Reproductions of the originals in the Huntington Library (Early English books 733:8) and the British Library (Thomason Tracts E.1027[3]).
